title: [ENH] GitHub actions? Automated pointer and help for new contributors failing linting tests

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

body:
Good first issue for someone who knows GitHub actions well:

By now, I've encountered perhaps dozens of situations where a new contributor's great contribution is almost ready to merge, but fails our linting tests.
In that situation, I found myself writing the same (hopefully helpful) tutorial post in the PR, which makes the contributor aware of the failing tests and points to our conventions and dev documentation.

I don't think this is the contributors' fault, since linting conventions may differ by repository and do not always exist; also, it is not a very beginner friendly situation if one hasn't seen this before, and core devs take days to reply to explain what is wrong.

Surely, it must be possible to have a bot or similar post that same helpful message that I've been writing in variations (perhaps an "extended version" with links and granular steps)?

As said, might be a good first issue and a flick of the wrist for someone who knows how to do this with GitHub actions.
